hypothesis_content.title: Volatility Compression Breakout Fade in Low Conviction Regimes
hypothesis_content.statement: During NEUTRAL regimes, when BTC 7-day realized volatility drops below 30% (annualized) and price breaks above the 20-day Bollinger Band upper band on below-average volume (< 90% of 30-day avg), fading the breakout with a short entry yields positive expectancy as false breakouts revert.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Low volatility breakouts on weak volume in neutral regimes are often liquidity grabs. The lack of conviction suggests limited follow-through, creating high-probability mean reversion opportunities.
entry_conditions: Price closes above 20-day Bollinger Band upper band
Breakout day volume < 90% of 30-day average volume

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price returns to middle Bollinger Band OR 4% profit
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price closes > 2% above breakout candle high

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 35% of such breakouts continue upward >8% without retracing to middle BB, indicating genuine momentum shifts.
